message_1: A radioactive substance has a half-life of 10 years. If the initial amount of the substance was 500 grams, find the amount of substance that remains after 30 years.
message_2:
To find the amount of substance remaining after 30 years, we can use the formula:

Final amount = Initial amount * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial amount is 500 grams, the time elapsed is 30 years, and the half-life is 10 years. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final amount = 500 * (1/2)^(30 / 10)
Final amount = 500 * (1/2)^3
Final amount = 500 * (1/8)
Final amount = 62.5 grams

So, after 30 years, 62.5 grams of the radioactive substance will remain.
